## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 366, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 170, 905, 186]]<|/det|>
0625/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 231]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 247, 504, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 435, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 336, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 353, 115, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>?</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 352, 599, 369]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 369, 907, 400]]<|/det|>
For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 400, 578, 415]]<|/det|>
Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 416, 275, 431]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 431, 868, 462]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 462, 326, 476]]<|/det|>
Do not use correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 477, 364, 492]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 493, 328, 507]]<|/det|>
You may use a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 507, 680, 523]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(9.8\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 566, 540, 616]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 40. Each correct answer will score one mark. Any rough working should be done on this question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 847, 728, 864]]<|/det|>

The diagram shows a ray of light in an optical fibre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 484, 134, 502]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 484, 920, 518]]<|/det|>
The glass must slow the light as little as possible to make the critical angle for the fibre as large as possible.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 526, 131, 544]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 526, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
The glass must slow the light as little as possible to make the critical angle for the fibre as small as possible.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 567, 131, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 567, 920, 600]]<|/det|>
The glass must slow the light as much as possible to make the critical angle for the fibre as large as possible.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 609, 131, 626]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 609, 920, 641]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|> When a conductor in a complete circuit cuts across a magnetic field, a current is induced in the conductor. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 117, 564, 134]]<|/det|> Which statement about the induced current is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 145, 134, 163]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 144, 774, 161]]<|/det|> The induced current is in the same direction as the motion of the conductor. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 171, 133, 190]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 170, 794, 187]]<|/det|> The induced current is in the opposite direction to the motion of the conductor. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 197, 133, 215]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 197, 821, 214]]<|/det|> The direction of the induced current is in the same direction as the magnetic field. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 223, 133, 241]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 223, 707, 240]]<|/det|> The direction of the induced current opposes the change causing it. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 268, 104, 287]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 268, 599, 286]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a solenoid carrying an electric current. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 294, 650, 389]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 401, 920, 434]]<|/det|> Which row compares the strength of the magnetic field due to the solenoid at points Y and Z with the strength of the magnetic field at point X? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 445, 541, 591]]<|/det|>
magnetic field
strength at Y		magnetic field
strength at Z
Aequal to Xless than X
Bequal to Xgreater than X
Cgreater than Xless than X
Dgreater than Xgreater than X

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|> A conducting wire is placed between the poles of a magnet. When an electric current in the wire is in the direction shown, then the force on the wire acts out of the page. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 114, 601, 203]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 218, 767, 237]]<|/det|> Three statements of different conditions and how the wire is affected are given. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 249, 203, 266]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 248, 920, 282]]<|/det|> When the current is towards the top of the page and the direction of the magnetic field is unchanged, the force produced acts into the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 291, 203, 308]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 289, 920, 323]]<|/det|> When the current is towards the bottom of the page and the magnetic field is reversed, the force produced acts into the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 330, 205, 348]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 330, 920, 348]]<|/det|> When the current in the wire is alternating, the wire vibrates into and out of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 361, 371, 378]]<|/det|> Which statements are correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 388, 131, 406]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 388, 170, 406]]<|/det|> 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 388, 203, 406]]<|/det|> 2 and 3 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 388, 298, 406]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 388, 425, 406]]<|/det|> 1 and 2 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 388, 468, 406]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 388, 491, 406]]<|/det|> 1 and 3 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[505, 388, 526, 406]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[529, 388, 551, 406]]<|/det|> 2 and 3 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 433, 104, 452]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 433, 920, 467]]<|/det|> Which types of electric current are in the primary coil and the secondary coil of a step-up transformer? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 477, 421, 625]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 651, 104, 670]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 650, 920, 686]]<|/det|> A scientist fires alpha-particles at a very thin sheet of gold and detects the particles that pass through. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 695, 725, 714]]<|/det|> Which statement about the results of the scattering experiment is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 724, 131, 742]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 724, 771, 742]]<|/det|> Alpha-particles are attracted to the nucleus of the atoms in the metal sheet. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 751, 131, 768]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 751, 621, 768]]<|/det|> Half the mass of the atom is concentrated in the nucleus. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 777, 131, 795]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 777, 818, 795]]<|/det|> Most of the alpha-particles are deflected, showing that the nucleus is very dense. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 803, 131, 821]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 803, 920, 836]]<|/det|> Only a small number of alpha-particles are deflected, but some of these are deflected through large angles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 542, 89]]<|/det|> The notation represents the nucleus of a gold atom. <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 106, 536, 135]]<|/det|> \[\mathrm{^{197}Au} \mathrm{^{197}Au}\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 153, 425, 171]]<|/det|> The relative charge on a proton is \(+1\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 183, 517, 201]]<|/det|> What is the relative charge on the gold nucleus? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 211, 134, 228]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 211, 186, 228]]<|/det|> +79 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 211, 306, 228]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 211, 364, 228]]<|/det|> +118 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 211, 475, 228]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[480, 211, 536, 228]]<|/det|> +197 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 211, 640, 228]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[650, 211, 700, 228]]<|/det|> +276 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 259, 106, 278]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 259, 544, 278]]<|/det|> An isotope of hydrogen has the nuclide notation \(_1^2 \text{H}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 293, 920, 327]]<|/det|> How many neutrons are in the nucleus of this isotope and what is the relative charge on the nucleus? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 337, 405, 484]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 464, 542, 482]]<|/det|> Which types of radiation are emitted by the source? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 494, 134, 511]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 494, 331, 511]]<|/det|> \(\alpha\) -particles and \(\gamma\) -rays <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 521, 134, 539]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 521, 282, 539]]<|/det|> \(\alpha\) -particles only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 549, 134, 567]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 549, 331, 567]]<|/det|> \(\beta\) -particles and \(\gamma\) -rays <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 576, 134, 594]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 576, 280, 594]]<|/det|> \(\beta\) -particles only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 619, 104, 636]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 618, 831, 636]]<|/det|> The reading on a detector placed near a radioactive material is 536 counts per second. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 649, 546, 666]]<|/det|> The background count rate is 44 counts per second. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 680, 534, 696]]<|/det|> The half-life of the radioactive material is 34 hours. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 710, 539, 727]]<|/det|> What is the reading on the detector after 68 hours? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 738, 134, 756]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 738, 332, 756]]<|/det|> 44 counts per second <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 765, 134, 782]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 765, 344, 782]]<|/det|> 123 counts per second <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 791, 134, 809]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 791, 344, 809]]<|/det|> 134 counts per second <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 817, 134, 835]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 817, 344, 835]]<|/det|> 167 counts per second
